member.name: F:ServiceStack.Razor.Managers.FileSystemWatcherLiveReload.FileSystemWatcher
member.summary: The purpose of the FileSystemWatcher is to ensure razor pages are consistent with the code generated by the razor engine. The file system watcher will invalidate pages and queue them for recompilation.

member.name: T:ServiceStack.Razor.Managers.RazorPageResolver
member.summary: A common hook into ServiceStack and the hosting infrastructure used to resolve requests.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Razor.Managers.RazorPageResolver.ProcessRequestAsync(ServiceStack.Web.IRequest,ServiceStack.Web.IResponse,System.String)
member.summary: This is called by the hosting environment via CatchAll usually for content pages.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Razor.Managers.RazorPageResolver.ProcessRequestAsync(ServiceStack.Web.IRequest,System.Object,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Called by the HtmlFormat:IPlugin who checks to see if any registered view engines can handle the response DTO. If this view engine can handle the response DTO, then process it, otherwise, returning false will allow another view engine to attempt to process it. If no view engines can process the DTO, HtmlFormat will simply handle it itself.

member.name: T:ServiceStack.Razor.Managers.RazorViewManager
member.summary: This view manager is responsible for keeping track of all the available Razor views and states of Razor pages.

member.name: T:ServiceStack.Razor.AttributeValue
member.summary: Class to represent attribute values and, more importantly, decipher them from tuple madness slightly.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Formats.MarkdownFormat.SerializeToStreamAsync(ServiceStack.Web.IRequest,System.Object,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Render Markdown for text/markdown and text/plain ContentTypes

member.name: T:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgery
member.summary: Provides access to the anti-forgery system, which provides protection against Cross-site Request Forgery (XSRF, also called CSRF) attacks.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgery.GetHtml
member.summary: Generates an anti-forgery token for this request. This token can be validated by calling the Validate() method.
member.returns: An HTML string corresponding to an <input type="hidden"> element. This element should be put inside a <form>.
member.remarks: This method has a side effect: it may set a response cookie.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgery.GetTokens(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Generates an anti-forgery token pair (cookie and form token) for this request. This method is similar to GetHtml(), but this method gives the caller control over how to persist the returned values. To validate these tokens, call the appropriate overload of Validate.
member.param: The anti-forgery token - if any - that already existed for this request. May be null. The anti-forgery system will try to reuse this cookie value when generating a matching form token.

Will contain a new cookie value if the old cookie token was null or invalid. If this value is non-null when the method completes, the caller must persist this value in the form of a response cookie, and the existing cookie value should be discarded. If this value is null when the method completes, the existing cookie value was valid and needn't be modified.
The value that should be stored in the <form>. The caller should take care not to accidentally swap the cookie and form tokens.
member.remarks: Unlike the GetHtml() method, this method has no side effect. The caller is responsible for setting the response cookie and injecting the returned form token as appropriate.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgery.Validate
member.summary: Validates an anti-forgery token that was supplied for this request. The anti-forgery token may be generated by calling GetHtml().
member.remarks: Throws an HttpAntiForgeryException if validation fails.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgery.Validate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates an anti-forgery token pair that was generated by the GetTokens method.
member.param: The token that was supplied in the request cookie.
The token that was supplied in the request form body.
member.remarks: Throws an HttpAntiForgeryException if validation fails.

member.name: T:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgeryConfig
member.summary: Provides programmatic configuration for the anti-forgery token system.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgeryConfig.AdditionalDataProvider
member.summary: Specifies an object that can provide additional data to put into all generated tokens and that can validate additional data in incoming tokens.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgeryConfig.CookieName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the cookie that is used by the anti-forgery system.
member.remarks: If an explicit name is not provided, the system will automatically generate a name.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgeryConfig.RequireSsl
member.summary: Specifies whether SSL is required for the anti-forgery system to operate. If this setting is 'true' and a non-SSL request comes into the system, all anti-forgery APIs will fail.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgeryConfig.SuppressIdentityHeuristicChecks
member.summary: Specifies whether the anti-forgery system should skip checking for conditions that might indicate misuse of the system. Please use caution when setting this switch, as improper use could open security holes in the application.
member.remarks: Setting this switch will disable several checks, including: - Identity.IsAuthenticated = true without Identity.Name being set - special-casing claims-based identities

member.name: P:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.AntiForgeryConfig.UniqueClaimTypeIdentifier
member.summary: If claims-based authorization is in use, specifies the claim type from the identity that is used to uniquely identify the user. If this property is set, all claims-based identities must return unique values for this claim type.
member.remarks: If claims-based authorization is in use and this property has not been set, the anti-forgery system will automatically look for claim types "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier" and "http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/identityprovider".

member.name: T:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.IAntiForgeryAdditionalDataProvider
member.summary: Allows providing or validating additional custom data for anti-forgery tokens. For example, the developer could use this to supply a nonce when the token is generated, then he could validate the nonce when the token is validated.
member.remarks: The anti-forgery system already embeds the client's username within the generated tokens. This interface provides and consumes supplemental data. If an incoming anti-forgery token contains supplemental data but no additional data provider is configured, the supplemental data will not be validated.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.IAntiForgeryAdditionalDataProvider.GetAdditionalData(System.Web.HttpContextBase)
member.summary: Provides additional data to be stored for the anti-forgery tokens generated during this request.
member.returns: Supplemental data to embed within the anti-forgery token.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Html.AntiXsrf.IAntiForgeryAdditionalDataProvider.ValidateAdditionalData(System.Web.HttpContextBase,System.String)
member.summary: Validates additional data that was embedded inside an incoming anti-forgery token.
member.param: Supplemental data that was embedded within the token.
member.returns: True if the data is valid; false if the data is invalid.

member.name: M:ServiceStack.Html.ScopeStorageDictionary.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Object,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The dictionary to use as a storage. Since the dictionary would be used as-is, we expect the implementer to use the same key-value comparison logic as we do here.

member.name: T:ServiceStack.Html.ScopeStorageComparer
member.summary: Custom comparer for the context dictionaries The comparer treats strings as a special case, performing case insesitive comparison. This guaratees that we remain consistent throughout the chain of contexts since PageData dictionary behaves in this manner.

All variables passed to and created by your page. The Response DTO is stored and accessible via the 'Model' variable.
All variables and outputs created are stored in ScopeArgs which is what's available to your website template. The Generated page is stored in the 'Body' variable.

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.MarkdownOptions.AutoHyperlink
member.summary: when true, (most) bare plain URLs are auto-hyperlinked WARNING: this is a significant deviation from the markdown spec

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.MarkdownOptions.AutoNewlines
member.summary: when true, RETURN becomes a literal newline WARNING: this is a significant deviation from the markdown spec

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.MarkdownOptions.EmptyElementSuffix
member.summary: use ">" for HTML output, or " />" for XHTML output

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.MarkdownOptions.EncodeProblemUrlCharacters
member.summary: when true, problematic URL characters like [, ], (, and so forth will be encoded WARNING: this is a significant deviation from the markdown spec

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.MarkdownOptions.LinkEmails
member.summary: when false, email addresses will never be auto-linked WARNING: this is a significant deviation from the markdown spec

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.MarkdownOptions.StrictBoldItalic
member.summary: when true, bold and italic require non-word characters on either side WARNING: this is a significant deviation from the markdown spec

member.name: T:MarkdownSharp.Markdown
member.summary: Markdown is a text-to-HTML conversion tool for web writers. Markdown allows you to write using an easy-to-read, easy-to-write plain text format, then convert it to structurally valid XHTML (or HTML).

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new Markdown instance using default options

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Create a new Markdown instance and optionally load options from a configuration file. There they should be stored in the appSettings section, available options are:
Markdown.StrictBoldItalic (true/false) Markdown.EmptyElementSuffix (">" or " />" without the quotes) Markdown.LinkEmails (true/false) Markdown.AutoNewLines (true/false) Markdown.AutoHyperlink (true/false) Markdown.EncodeProblemUrlCharacters (true/false)

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.#ctor(MarkdownSharp.MarkdownOptions)
member.summary: Create a new Markdown instance and set the options from the MarkdownOptions object.

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.EmptyElementSuffix
member.summary: use ">" for HTML output, or " />" for XHTML output

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.LinkEmails
member.summary: when false, email addresses will never be auto-linked WARNING: this is a significant deviation from the markdown spec

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.StrictBoldItalic
member.summary: when true, bold and italic require non-word characters on either side WARNING: this is a significant deviation from the markdown spec

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.AutoNewLines
member.summary: when true, RETURN becomes a literal newline WARNING: this is a significant deviation from the markdown spec

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.AutoHyperlink
member.summary: when true, (most) bare plain URLs are auto-hyperlinked WARNING: this is a significant deviation from the markdown spec

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.EncodeProblemUrlCharacters
member.summary: when true, problematic URL characters like [, ], (, and so forth will be encoded WARNING: this is a significant deviation from the markdown spec

member.name: F:MarkdownSharp.Markdown._nestDepth
member.summary: maximum nested depth of [] and () supported by the transform; implementation detail

member.name: F:MarkdownSharp.Markdown._tabWidth
member.summary: Tabs are automatically converted to spaces as part of the transform this constant determines how "wide" those tabs become in spaces

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.#cctor
member.summary: In the static constuctor we'll initialize what stays the same across all transforms.

member.name: P:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.Version
member.summary: current version of MarkdownSharp; see http://code.google.com/p/markdownsharp/ for the latest code or to contribute

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.Transform(System.String)
member.summary: Transforms the provided Markdown-formatted text to HTML; see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown
member.remarks: The order in which other subs are called here is essential. Link and image substitutions need to happen before EscapeSpecialChars(), so that any *'s or _'s in the a and img tags get encoded.

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.RunBlockGamut(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform transformations that form block-level tags like paragraphs, headers, and list items.

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.RunSpanGamut(System.String)
member.summary: Perform transformations that occur *within* block-level tags like paragraphs, headers, and list items.

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.FormParagraphs(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: splits on two or more newlines, to form "paragraphs"; each paragraph is then unhashed (if it is a hash and unhashing isn't turned off) or wrapped in HTML p tag

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.GetNestedBracketsPattern
member.summary: Reusable pattern to match balanced [brackets]. See Friedl's "Mastering Regular Expressions", 2nd Ed., pp. 328-331.

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.GetNestedParensPattern
member.summary: Reusable pattern to match balanced (parens). See Friedl's "Mastering Regular Expressions", 2nd Ed., pp. 328-331.

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.StripLinkDefinitions(System.String)
member.summary: Strips link definitions from text, stores the URLs and titles in hash references.

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.GetBlockPattern
member.summary: derived pretty much verbatim from PHP Markdown

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.HashHTMLBlocks(System.String)
member.summary: replaces any block-level HTML blocks with hash entries

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.TokenizeHTML(System.String)
member.summary: returns an array of HTML tokens comprising the input string. Each token is either a tag (possibly with nested, tags contained therein, such as <a href="<MTFoo>">, or a run of text between tags. Each element of the array is a two-element array; the first is either 'tag' or 'text'; the second is the actual value.

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoAnchors(System.String)
member.summary: Turn Markdown link shortcuts into HTML anchor tags

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoImages(System.String)
member.summary: Turn Markdown image shortcuts into HTML img tags.

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoHeaders(System.String)
member.summary: Turn Markdown headers into HTML header tags
member.remarks:
Header 1 ========
Header 2 --------
# Header 1 ## Header 2 ## Header 2 with closing hashes ## ... ###### Header 6

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoHorizontalRules(System.String)
member.summary: Turn Markdown horizontal rules into HTML hr tags

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoLists(System.String)
member.summary: Turn Markdown lists into HTML ul and ol and li tags

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.ProcessListItems(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Process the contents of a single ordered or unordered list, splitting it into individual list items.

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoCodeBlocks(System.String)
member.summary: /// Turn Markdown 4-space indented code into HTML pre code blocks

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoCodeSpans(System.String)
member.summary: Turn Markdown `code spans` into HTML code tags

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoItalicsAndBold(System.String)
member.summary: Turn Markdown *italics* and **bold** into HTML strong and em tags

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoHardBreaks(System.String)
member.summary: Turn markdown line breaks (two space at end of line) into HTML break tags

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoBlockQuotes(System.String)
member.summary: Turn Markdown > quoted blocks into HTML blockquote blocks

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.DoAutoLinks(System.String)
member.summary: Turn angle-delimited URLs into HTML anchor tags

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.Outdent(System.String)
member.summary: Remove one level of line-leading spaces

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.EncodeEmailAddress(System.String)
member.summary: encodes email address randomly roughly 10% raw, 45% hex, 45% dec note that @ is always encoded and : never is

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.EncodeCode(System.String)
member.summary: Encode/escape certain Markdown characters inside code blocks and spans where they are literals

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.EncodeAmpsAndAngles(System.String)
member.summary: Encode any ampersands (that aren't part of an HTML entity) and left or right angle brackets

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.EscapeBackslashes(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes any escaped characters such as \`, \*, \[ etc

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.Unescape(System.String)
member.summary: swap back in all the special characters we've hidden

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.EscapeBoldItalic(System.String)
member.summary: escapes Bold [ * ] and Italic [ _ ] characters

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.EncodeProblemUrlChars(System.String)
member.summary: hex-encodes some unusual "problem" chars in URLs to avoid URL detection problems

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.EscapeSpecialCharsWithinTagAttributes(System.String)
member.summary: Within tags -- meaning between < and > -- encode [\ ` * _] so they don't conflict with their use in Markdown for code, italics and strong. We're replacing each such character with its corresponding hash value; this is likely overkill, but it should prevent us from colliding with the escape values by accident.

member.name: M:MarkdownSharp.Markdown.Normalize(System.String)

member.summary: this is to emulate what's evailable in PHP
